pull.title: Add CChain object for headers-only chain
pull.body:
This PR introduces a `CChain` object for the headers chain. It allows to better inspect the headers chain (things like reorg detection). It would simplify a lot of things for a possible light client (SPV) mode.

Slightly improves the headers-chain fork reporting in `getchaintips`.

verification.payload:
tree 7c9abd24797aabcb55766970d394e88866d9c4e8
parent 6adc3a37324caa07015368bfe8529e1964366eef
author Jonas Schnelli <dev@jonasschnelli.ch> 1483089304 +0100
committer Jonas Schnelli <dev@jonasschnelli.ch> 1500645160 +0200

Add CChain object for headers-only chain

events.message: Add CChain object for headers-only chain

events.body: It is unnecessary to add a new CChain object (3.5 MiB of RAM) for this. You can test whether `pindex` is an ancestor of `pindexBestHeader` using 'pindexBestHeader->GetAncestor(pindex->nHeight) == pindex`.

@sipa:
For the light client headers based fork detection the `FindFork()` method would be very handy. Maybe have a look at the "sketch" SPV code for the wallet: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9483/files#diff-b2bb174788c7409b671c46ccc86034bdR1182
If one runs in full non validation mode (light client mode), the memory consumption would be ~the same, because only the headers chain will require memory (the `chainActive` will be empty).
@jonasschnelli You can use FindCommonAncestor between two CBlockIndex objects if you don't have a CChain, instead of FindFork.

Thanks @sipa. Makes sense.
Closing for now.

@jonasschnelli @sipa If this is no longer relevant I suggest removing it from the "Client-Mode (SPV)" project to reduce noise (especially since there are *already* two other, somewhat overlapping, PRs in the project)
